sub_title: Portfolio Leader | IKEA Identity, Range and Marketing Communication | Core Business Franchise
summary:
Currently, I work as a Portfolio Leader | IKEA Identity, Range and Marketing Communication | Core Business Franchise, assignment related to communication, coordination and follow up of portfolio realisation within IIRC and empowering and motivating the Project leaders to drive the business forward with good results. My responsibility is to enable fact-based decision making through the provision of insights based on portfolio and stakeholder information, to drive the resolution of impediments on the portfolio level and to measure portfolio performance and track OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) and other metrics to understand progress on value realization. In this role, I work closely together with peers across the totality of Core Business Franchise and across IKEA to strengthen and contribute to a strong and relevant IKEA franchise offer.​ 

What do you need to know in order to be effective? Strong organizational and communication skills, including active listening and the ability to communicate complex issues in a simple way. Knowledge of lean budgeting processes and agile portfolio operations.​ 

What do you need to​ be able to do in order to be effective? Strong stakeholder management skills and the ability to liaise with different parts of the organization to maximize efficiency.​ Strong analytical skills and the ability to understand and synthesize data to see trends.

profile_positions.description: Currently, responsible as Portfolio Leader for IKEA Identity, Range and Marketing Communication to coordinate and follow up on portfolio realisation and to empower and motivate the activity owners to drive the business forward with good results, to enable fact-based decision making through the provision of insights based portfolio and stakeholder information and drive the resolution of impediments on portfolio level. My responsibility is to provide portfolio support for portfolio coordinators by leading lean budgeting processes, agile portfolio ceremonies and lean governance and measuring portfolio performance and​ tracking OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) and other metrics to understand progress on value realization. It is an assignment that requires me to act as coordinator between portfolio team(s), Business Owners, and Product Area Managers and to liaise with Finance to ensure the effective management of funding and financial tracking across product areas. As Portfolio Leader I work closely together with peers across the totality of Core Business Franchise and across IKEA to strengthen and contribute to a strong and relevant IKEA franchise offer.​ What do you need to​be able to do in order to be effective? Strong stakeholder management skills and ability to liaise with different parts of the organization to maximize efficiency.​ Strong analytical skills and the ability to understand and synthesize data to see trends.​ Ability to organize, facilitate and support large meetings with multiple teams.​Ability to coordinate multiple stakeholders. Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
profile_positions.title: Portfolio Leader | IKEA Identity, Range and Marketing Communication | Core Business Franchise

profile_positions.description: Responsible as Project leader to contribute to RD business goals, objectives and strategies set by the Range Dimensioning Programme directive. One of my tasks is to apply existing processes, principles and governance by monitoring and managing or safeguarding that we follow the agreed result within RD Programme plan including scope, cost, time plan, quality of results, resources and risks. Hence to secure a successful communication with all identified and relevant stakeholders and to manage stakeholders, dependencies and interfaces, within the project and between programme and line organization. In addition, to highlight risks and follow a mitigation plan for it and throughout to identify areas of improvement and to drive appropriate actions to resolution. The purpose of the Range Dimensioning programme is to enable the successful development and deployment of a unique, relevant and commercial range, across the whole of IKEA at the lowest total cost and within the decided frames. A relevant range in all customer meeting points.
profile_positions.title: PROJECT LEADER IIRC  within Range Dimensioning Programme and Range Allocation as part of Range Offer

profile_positions.description: I started in CBF, IIRC in October 2020 joining the Business Navigation Team as a Project Controller responsible to lead the controlling of projects, activities, and initiatives and ensuring that results are achieved within the agreed time frame. Hence, my role was to drive the development of our end to end work processes, working methods and working tools, to ensure a close collaboration and to support the business owner to report and follow up the set goals. Another responsibility is to ensure that together with Business Navigator we follow up a Project Portfolio, considering the business impact compared to baseline goals. In addition, to secure that purchase orders are in place. In this role it was required to prove to have experience in project controlling and portfolio management, to have experience in leading and influencing people in a changing, international and culturally diverse work environment. In addition, in this role, I could prove that I have an understanding of our role as a franchisor as well as our responsibility within IKEA system.
profile_positions.title: PROJECT CONTROLLER IIRC  within IKEA Identity Range and Communication as part of Business Navigation

company.name: IKEA Sverige, Inter IKEA Group, IKEA of SWEDEN AB

profile_positions.description:
Main role: GLOBAL PROJECT CONTROLLER KITCHEN FURNITURE at IKEA of SWEDEN, Sweden
On the side projects, additional responsibilities: 
1.	6 months:    ACTING BUSINESS NAVIGATOR for 6 months (assignment completed)
2.	1,5 years: IMPLEMENTATION of the CIRCULAR DELIVERABLES for all project teams (assignment completed)
3.	2 months: Launch of the PEOPLE and TOGEHTERNESS an HR project (assignment completed)

Currently, I work as a Project Controller for “Kitchen Furniture and Interior organisers” at IKEA of SWEDEN and lead within two project teams, several projects (global product range within Kitchen Home Furnishing) and I am responsible for the process from start to end, ensuring to activate the right competences and content owner and roles into the right IKEA New Projects Development Phases at the required moment. Communication abilities and customer understanding is a prerequisite requested in this role, I work with many internal and external stakeholders and several specialists that are dependent on the relevant information at the right time.
I work actively with project management to ensure that the team delivers to project ambition and time plan, secure deviations handling and compliance to processes, working methods and business rules. Another responsibility is to map and highlight the project risks and interdependencies. I act as an IKEA ambassador for a performance culture, works to enhance business understanding in the unit.
profile_positions.title: GLOBAL PROJECT CONTROLLER KITCHEN FURNITURE at IKEA of SWEDEN, Sweden

profile_positions.description:
ASSISTANT FOR THE PURCHASING HR MANAGER for “Better Purchasing Reorganization” & “Leading Business & People Programme” within HR department at IKEA of Sweden

Project Management Assistant for the “Better Purchasing Programme &
Leading Business & People” organizing assessment centres aiming for a better IKEA Purchasing with the aim to ensure that IKEA ways of working enables IKEA to grow and develop according to Growing IKEA Together 2020 and beyond. Assisting manager for all work related activities within the 2 projects like organizing activities, project facilitation, the editing and publishing competence profiles, reports, organizing support for assessment centres for category managers, BDM,  business  controllers, project controllers, demand planner, business navigator managers; Within “Leading Business & People Programme” facilitating all requested required organization working closely with the core competence manager and category managers for flat line and textile.
profile_positions.title: ASSISTANT FOR THE PURCHASING HR MANAGER for “Better Purchasing Reorganization” & “Leading Business &

profile_positions.description:
Purchasing Analyst for LIDL Purchasing Food Department
(Covering the food segment for fresh meat, fresh fish, milk-yoghurt and cheese products). Responsible work producing variety of tasks and reports like: Order analysis, Forecasting, Purchasing tasks, Maintaining current stock and order sheets, buying price, retail price and competitive price overviews, Liaising with suppliers, Monitoring  progress of all ongoing works ensuring all deadlines are met, Performance reporting Write-Offs, Ordering, Sales review and analysis, Seasonal/Event planning, Contracts, Optimum allocation of food and fresh products within a rapidly and continuously expanding and growing sector with about 180 LIDL retail stores. Main language spoken and tools: German.
profile_positions.title: PURCHASING ANALYST LIDL - Purchasing Department Food

profile_positions.description:
As a development and fund raising responsible at “Caritas Bucharest
Association”, I was assigned with the coordination of the fund raising department and of the PR & Communication Department. Within my assignment at CARITAS, I managed to attract support for approx.  200.000 Euro. 

The main tasks concerned the development of a strategy to increase the capacity of the association, the identification of new sustainable partnerships and promotion of Caritas Bucharest activities and projects, at a broader level for the advantage of its beneficiaries. This networking and negotiation position allowed me to establish contacts with many people, to coordinate efforts with the others, inside and outside the organization, and to attain the planned and envisioned goals and results. At the same time, another task was the coordination of the marketing and communication department leading to a strengthened image of the organization, acknowledgment and support for its activities by concluding new social responsibility partnerships.
profile_positions.title: COORDINATION OF THE FUNDRAISING, MARKETING and COMMUNICATION AT "CARITAS ORGANISATION BUCHAREST"

company.name: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH

profile_positions.company: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH
profile_positions.description:
AT GIZ DEUTSCHE GESELLSCHAFT FUER INTERNATIONALE ZUSAMMENARBEIT I was employed as a Project Manager for the textile and clothing industry within the Program developed by the GIZ German Agency for International Cooperation designed for economic development and employment promotion in Romania (the GIZ Program) – a bilateral program developed by the Romanian and German Governments, supported by the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)

The major task was to fully coordinate various projects, together with various teams, depending on the dimensions of the project. The main activities contributed for promoting and intensifying the contacts with our partners at micro-, mid-, and macroeconomic levels, providing assistance, together with the German experts of GIZ, and to participate in various specialized fairs and economic missions in Germany and Austria. Within the economic development project I was responsible to organise and promote the “Congress on the Textile and Clothing Industry in South East Europe” at European, to set up of the Consultative Council of the Romanian Clothing Industry by GIZ. 

Depending on the dimensions and number of the projects, I coordinated teams of 2 – 4 persons, based on the specific requirements of each project.
profile_positions.title: PROJECT MANAGER FOR THE TEXTILE AND CLOTHING INDUSTRY

skills: GERMAN, ENGLISH, ROMANIAN, basic SWEDISH spoken languages
